post-fdp-dialog/title: POST metadata to FAIR Data Point
post-fdp-dialog/description: Fill in the base URI of your desired FAIR Data Point.
post-fdp-dialog/connected-to-fdp: You are now using FAIR Data Point
connect-fdp-command/error: Cannot connect to entered FAIR Data Point.
connect-fdp-command/success: Successfully connected to FAIR Data Point.
metadata/catalog/dialog-title: Add new catalog to FAIR Data Point
metadata/catalog/title/description: A name given to the catalog.
metadata/catalog/version/description: The version number for this resource.
metadata/catalog/publisher/description: The entity responsible for making the catalog online.
metadata/catalog/description/description: A free-text account of the catalog.
metadata/catalog/language/description: The language of the catalog. This refers to the language used in the textual metadata describing titles, descriptions, etc. of the datasets in the catalog.
metadata/catalog/license/description: This links to the license document under which the catalog is made available and not the datasets. Even if the license of the catalog applies to all of its datasets and distributions, it should be replicated on each distribution.
metadata/catalog/rights/description: This describes the rights under which the catalog can be used/reused and not the datasets. Even if theses rights apply to all the catalog datasets and distributions, it should be replicated on each distribution.
metadata/catalog/themeTaxonomies/descrip: The knowledge organization system (KOS) used to classify catalog's datasets.
metadata/dataset/title/description: A name given to the Dataset. A dataset is a collection of data, published or curated by a single agent, and available for access or download in one or more formats.
metadata/dataset/version/description: The version number for this Dataset. Can accept arbitrary string values.
metadata/dataset/publisher/description: All entities (person, groups, institutions) responsible for making the dataset available. Consider who is the data owner, funding agency of the data, legal authority granting permission to the data.
metadata/dataset/description/description: A free-text account of the dataset.
metadata/dataset/themes/description: A computer readable keyword describing the dataset. A dataset can have multiple themes.
metadata/dataset/contactPoint/descriptio: Link a dataset to relevant contact information which is provided using VCard.
metadata/dataset/keywords/description: A keyword or tag describing the dataset.
metadata/dataset/landingPage/description: A Web page that can be navigated to in a Web browser to gain access to the dataset, its distributions and/or additional information.
metadata/distribution/title/description: A name given to the Distribution. Roughly, specifies the ‘format’ or concrete representation of the dataset (see Media Type below) and how it can be accessed. A dataset may have multiple distributions.
metadata/distribution/license/descriptio: This links to the license document under which the distribution is made available.
metadata/distribution/version/descriptio: The version number for this resource.
metadata/distribution/rights/description: Information about rights held in and over the distribution.
metadata/distribution/format/description: The file format of the distribution.
metadata/distribution/bytesize/descripti: The size of a distribution in bytes.
metadata/distribution/mediaType/descript: The media type of the distribution as defined by IANA.
metadata/distribution/accessUrl/descript: A landing page, feed, SPARQL endpoint or other type of resource that gives access to the distribution of the dataset.
metadata/distribution/downloadUrl/descri: A file that contains the distribution of the dataset in a given format.
